PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_ControllerTypeProportional
PropertySetDef.Definition: Properties for signal handling for an proportional controller taking setpoint and feedback inputs and creating a single valued output. HISTORY: In IFC4, SignalFactor1, SignalFactor2 and SignalFactor3 changed to ProportionalConstant, IntegralConstant and DerivativeConstant. SignalTime1 and SignalTime2 changed to SignalTimeIncrease and SignalTimeDecrease.

PropertyDef.Name: ControlType
PropertyDef.Definition: The type controller, signal modification effected and applicable ports

PropertyDef.Name: Labels
PropertyDef.Definition: Table mapping values to labels, where such labels indicate the meanings of True and False, such as 'Open' and 'Closed'

PropertyDef.Name: Range
PropertyDef.Definition: The physical range of values supported by the device.

PropertyDef.Name: Value
PropertyDef.Definition: The expected range and default value.

PropertyDef.Name: ProportionalConstant
PropertyDef.Definition: The proportional gain factor of the controller (usually referred to as Kp).

PropertyDef.Name: IntegralConstant
PropertyDef.Definition: The integral gain factor of the controller (usually referred to as Ki). Asserted where ControlType is PROPORTIONALINTEGRAL or PROPORTIONALINTEGRALDERIVATIVE.

PropertyDef.Name: DerivativeConstant
PropertyDef.Definition: The derivative gain factor of the controller (usually referred to as Kd). Asserted where ControlType is PROPORTIONALINTEGRALDERIVATIVE.

PropertyDef.Name: SignalTimeIncrease
PropertyDef.Definition: Time factor used for exponential increase.

PropertyDef.Name: SignalTimeDecrease
PropertyDef.Definition: Time factor used for exponential decrease.
